definition: to demonstrate (as a protest)/a demonstration/a military show of force

pinyin: jing4 zuo4 kang4 yi4 shi4 wei1

sentences.english: Yesterday, protesters smashed cars carrying the prime minister and his aides.
sentences.chinese: 昨天，示威者搗破載着總理及其助理的汽車。

sentences.english: "No to corruption," they say. "No to dictatorship."
sentences.chinese: 示威者提出“不要貪污，不要專政”。

sentences.english: An anti-nuclear demonstrator protest in Parliament Square in London March 14, 2007.
sentences.chinese: 英國倫敦國會廣場前抗議的反核示威者。

sentences.english: The Syrian government launched a violent campaign against pro-democracy protesters in March.
sentences.chinese: 敘利亞政府三月份對主張民主的示威者展開暴力鎮壓。

sentences.english: A group of people were expressing their support for the Palestinian people.
sentences.chinese: 一羣示威者亮出了支持巴勒斯坦的旗號。

sentences.english: Two downtown Portland parks where Occupy Portland demonstrators camped for weeks are clear Monday and police say crews will be removing debris and assessing damage.
sentences.chinese: 波特蘭兩個示威者宿營的城市公園在週一得到了清理。

sentences.english: The demonstration was carefully orchestrated to attract maximum publicity.
sentences.chinese: 該示威經過精心策畫以儘量吸引公衆注重。

sentences.english: The demonstration got out of control and fighting broke out.
sentences.chinese: 示威失去控制，繼而發生毆鬥。

sentences.english: But we will not stop the demonstrations until they are released.
sentences.chinese: 但在她們被釋放之前，我們不會停止示威。

sentences.english: The protesters are just reminding those in power to look down.
sentences.chinese: 示威者就是在提醒那些當權者往下看。

sentences.english: There might even be some pro-Gaza protests.
sentences.chinese: 甚至還會有些支持加沙的示威活動。

sentences.english: The angry shouts of the demonstrators rent the air.
sentences.chinese: 示威羣衆的怒吼震天動地。

sentences.english: The teachers picketed outside of the school building to express their frustration over low wages.
sentences.chinese: 教師們在校舍外示威，對低工資表示不滿。

sentences.english: Vigue said another 5,000 demonstrators were packed inside the building itself.
sentences.chinese: 同時，維格還說另外5000名示威者會在建築裏面。

sentences.english: Bakiyev has denied ordering troops to fire on protesters.
sentences.chinese: 巴基耶夫已否認命令軍隊向示威者開火。

sentences.english: The students were parading for peace.
sentences.chinese: 學生們示威遊行，要求和平。

definition: to show off one's military strength (idiom); to strut around/to bluff/to bluster
to cause trouble/to create a disturbance
